intro: Pseudellipanthus peltatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved pseudellipanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
